import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react' import Footer from './footer' import Navbar from './navbar' import { useParams } from 'react-router' import axios from 'axios' import { Baseurl } from '../baseurl' import { useLocation } from 'react-router' import { ToastContainer, toast } from 'react-toastify'; import 'react-toastify/dist/ReactToastify.css'; import { Link } from 'react-router-dom' import { items } from '../dashboard/suggestions' const CourseDetails = () => { let path = useLocation() const { code } = useParams(); const [course, setCourse] = useState({}) useEffect(() => { axios.get(`${Baseurl}coursedetails`, { params: { code: code } }).then((res) => { if (res.data) { setCourse(res.data) } }) }, []) const addToCart = () => { let cart = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('cart')) if (cart) { let courseDetails = { title: course.course_title, code: course.course_code, cost: course.course_cost, category: course.category, tutor: 'Great' } cart.push(courseDetails); localStorage.setItem('cart', JSON.stringify(cart)) toast("ðŸ˜” Added to Cart!", { autoClose: 2000, }) } else { let cart = []; let courseDetails = { courseCode: code } cart.push(courseDetails); localStorage.setItem('cart', JSON.stringify(cart)) } } const addwishlist = () => { let token = sessionStorage.Token axios.post(`${Baseurl}addwishlist`, { code: code }, { headers: { 'Authorization': 'Bearer' + token } }).then((res) => { if (res.data === 'added') { toast("ðŸ˜” Added!", { autoClose: 2000, }) } else if (res.data === 'alreadyAdded') { toast("ðŸ˜” Already Added!", { autoClose: 2000, }) } }).catch((error) => { if (error.response.status === 500) { sessionStorage.setItem('Path', path.pathname) } }) } return ( <>

Course Info
Description

Leaf/spine architectures have exploded in popularity within data centers and enterprise campus networks. In this course, Cisco Advanced Routing: Leaf/Spine Data Centers, youâ€™ll learn to design, configure, and manage a multi-site data center interconnected via layer-3 links. First, youâ€™ll expand your OSPF knowledge by learning about special area types and virtual links. Next, youâ€™ll discover using internal BGP for scalable distribution of IP prefixes within a data center fabric. Finally, youâ€™ll learn how to optimize the network using a subset of common IP services relating to management, monitoring, and security. Most of these topics are discussed using both IPv4 and IPv6 in the context of dual-stacking. When youâ€™re finished with this course, youâ€™ll have the skills and knowledge of Cisco layer-3 data center networking needed to deploy complex routing designs in your work environment.

About the Author

Nick Russo, CCDE #20160041 and CCIE #42518, is your go-to-guy for all things networking and automation. Nick loves training online and speaking at industry conferences sharing his expertise.When youâ€™re finished with this course, youâ€™ll have the skills and knowledge of Cisco layer-3 data center networking needed to deploy complex routing designs in your work environment.

  • Automating Multi-vendor and Cloud Networks Using Ansible
  • Cisco Advanced Routing: Troubleshooting with Cisco DNA Center Assurance
